ARTICLE.TITLE: Two women charged after homebirth death of Melbourne woman Caroline Emily Lovell
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Two women have been charged with negligent manslaughter over a fatal Melbourne homebirth more than eight years ago.

Caroline Emily Lovell, 36, died after giving birth in a pool at Watsonia in January 2012.

A 59-year-old Preston woman was arrested on Friday. Another women, aged 43, was also arrested at Mullumbimby, near Byron Bay, shortly afterwards.

They have been charged with Ms Lovell’s negligent manslaughter.

Coroner Peter White in 2016 found the 36-year-old died after losing a lot of blood giving birth to a healthy baby girl in a pool.

She gave birth in the dark and was left in the water for at least an hour without proper examination.

Ms Lovell lost consciousness temporarily before begging for an ambulance because she thought she was dying.

Camera Icon Gaye Demanuele. Credit: supplied

Mr White found former midwife Gaye Demanuele “acted quite as she pleased” and ignored the pleas until the mother eventually collapsed.

Ms Demanuele, who later de-registered herself as a midwife, was assisted at the birth by Melody Bourne and a doula.

Ms Lovell suffered a post-partum haemorrhage before dying in hospital, leaving behind her newborn daughter and an older girl.

Mr White referred the case to the Director of Public Prosecutions, saying her death was avoidable and Ms Demanuele’s inadequate management contributed.

Ms Lovell had told Ms Demanuele she believed she had suffered a tear during her first child’s delivery. But Ms Demanuele did not seek relevant medical records from the hospital involved or consult with the woman’s GP, according to the inquest.

She didn’t create a safe environment, with the dark room making it hard to see what had happened to the mother, and misled attending paramedics and the hospital, Mr White said.

The two women charged will appear in Melbourne Magistrates Court on August 21.

og.title: Duo charged over homebirth death
og.description: Two women have been charged with negligent manslaughter after a 36-year-old woman died during a homebirth more than eight years ago.
